name: sfchronicle
text: The S.F. Controller’s Office released a batch of recommendations for reforming contracting processes within the city’s Public Works Department following a sweeping probe launched in the wake of the unfolding public corruption scandal. https://t.co/nXxf9KIs1E

name: sfchronicle
text:
If the tentative schedule is not changed, The Giants will open the 60-game regular season at Dodger Stadium on July 23.

https://t.co/ga5Z45TOmP

name: sfchronicle
text:
As of Monday, 19 California counties — including Contra Costa, Santa Clara and Solano — are on a state watch list due to signs that coronavirus is spreading, potentially threatening to overload local hospitals. 
https://t.co/KWTOhH5Gh9

name: sfchronicle
text: The San Francisco Symphony paid tribute to Michael Tilson Thomas's quarter-century tenure as its orchestra's music director — online, of course. https://t.co/9B9zasH7SJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
While options for gatherings are limited in 2020, there are still plenty of possibilities to enjoy the July 4th weekend. We've compiled a list of ways to celebrate in the Bay Area — at a safe social distance or from home. 

https://t.co/yWqqF0eeg9

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Oakland A’s officially signed their top pick, 18-year-old catcher Tyler Soderstrom, on Monday, along with fifth pick Stevie Emanuels and three undrafted free agents.
https://t.co/mjKRKeKY3V

text: For months, the MLB has been embroiled in a bitter internal dispute over greed, @AnnKillion writes. https://t.co/9ecV17Qv1Y

name: sfchronicle
text: "Those moments of music — so urgent, so stirring — spoke more eloquently than any words could of the richness of Thomas’ legacy in the Bay Area," writes music critic @JoshuaKosman, of the S.F. Symphony's tribute to Michael Tilson Thomas: https://t.co/HybXek3o1i
